page.title: 06Unemployment in Laindon
page.content: A serious problem of 1985 is unemployment. The Basildon area has the highest unemployment rate in South East Essex and in May 1985 it stood at 14.7% compared with a national average of 13% The national decline of manufacturing industry is particularly worrying for Basildon, as 48.3% of those employed work in this sector. In the rest of Britain this averages 28.3%. The problem of unemployment may well continue to increase. The population of the area is still growing, and about 1,300 people enter the job market each year. Even to keep unemployment at its present level, 5,400 new jobs will have to be created by 1990. The A127 divides Basildon into two halves. To the north Billericay and Wickford have unemployment rates of 6%, but Laindon averages about 16%.
